summary: Comparative education refers to the systematic study and analysis of educational systems, policies, and practices across different countries or regions. Within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, comparative education serves as a vital tool for enhancing educational cooperation and harmonization among member states. It facilitates the identification of best practices, informs policy development, and supports the EU's objectives of promoting quality education and lifelong learning. By examining diverse educational models, comparative education contributes to the formulation of evidence-based regulations and directives aimed at fostering innovation and inclusivity in the European educational landscape.
